concept_definition: A person whose job is to instruct students in a school or other educational setting; someone who helps others learn by giving lessons or guidance.
A person who is trained and licensed to practice medicine and treat patients; a physician.

a person trained and licensed to care for the sick or injured, especially in a hospital or clinical setting; a healthcare professional who monitors patients, administers medications and treatments, and supports recovery and well‑being.

a person trained in or professionally engaged in the design, construction, and use of engines, machines, structures, or technological systems; a professional who applies scientific and mathematical principles to solve technical problems
a person who is trained and licensed to practice law, advise clients on legal matters, and represent them in legal proceedings
a member of a police force whose duties include enforcing laws, preventing and investigating crimes, and maintaining public order
a person whose job is to extinguish fires and rescue people and property from dangerous situations caused by fires or other emergencies
a professional cook, especially the chief cook in a restaurant or hotel, responsible for menu planning, food preparation, and kitchen management
A person who owns or manages a farm and is engaged in growing crops or raising livestock.
a person who operates and controls the flight of an aircraft
a person who operates and controls the steering and movement of a motor vehicle
a person who repairs and maintains machinery, engines, or mechanical equipment
A skilled tradesperson who installs, maintains, and repairs electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures in buildings and other structures.
A tradesperson who installs, repairs, and maintains pipes, fixtures, and fittings for water, gas, or sewage systems in buildings.
A skilled worker who builds, repairs, and installs wooden structures, fixtures, and fittings (such as buildings, furniture, and frameworks) using hand and power tools.
a person whose job or activity is applying paint to surfaces such as walls, buildings, furniture, or canvases
notes: Unclear if "house painter" or "artistic painter", differs in some languages.

concept_definition: A person who composes, conducts, or performs music, especially one who plays a musical instrument or sings professionally or as an amateur.
a person who creates works of art, such as paintings, sculptures, music, literature, or performances, often expressing imagination or technical skill
a person who writes, especially as an occupation or profession; someone who composes text such as books, articles, stories, or other written works
A person who investigates, writes, edits, or reports news and information for newspapers, magazines, radio, television, or online media.
A person who takes photographs, especially as a profession or hobby.
a medical professional who specializes in diagnosing, preventing, and treating diseases and conditions of the teeth, gums, and mouth
A person qualified to treat sick or injured animals; an animal doctor.
An office worker who handles correspondence, schedules, and administrative tasks for an individual or organization; an assistant responsible for clerical duties.
A person responsible for planning, directing, and overseeing the work and operations of a team, department, or organization to achieve specific goals.
a person whose job is to sell products or services to customers, either in a retail setting, by phone, or through other sales channels
a person whose job is cutting, trimming, and styling hair, especially men's hair, and often shaving or trimming facial hair
a person whose occupation is to make and bake bread, pastries, and other baked goods for sale
a person who serves in an army, especially one who fights in wars
A group of people related by blood, marriage, adoption, or a close, supportive domestic relationship; also, all descendants of a common ancestor.
a female parent; a woman who has given birth to or legally is the parent of a child, or who raises and cares for a child
a male parent; a man who has begotten or legally raised a child
A male sibling; a boy or man who has the same parent or parents as another person, or who is regarded as having a similar relationship (e.g., in a religious or fraternal context).
a female who has one or both parents in common with another person; a woman or girl in relation to her siblings
a male child in relation to his parents
a female child in relation to her parents; a woman considered as the offspring of her mother and father
the brother of one's father or mother; or the husband of one's aunt
the sister of one's father or mother, or the wife of one's uncle
a young human being between infancy and adolescence; a son or daughter of any age in relation to their parents.
a person who shares in an activity, business, or relationship with another; a member of a partnership (e.g., business partner, romantic partner, or dance partner).
a person who is married to another; a husband or wife
the male parent of a person's father or mother; the father of one's father or mother
the female parent of a person's mother or father; the mother of one's mother or father
a male child of one's son or daughter; the son of one's child
a daughter of one's son or daughter; the female child of one's child
a male child of one's uncle or aunt; a relative who shares a common grandparent
The female child of one's aunt or uncle; a person who shares a common grandparent with another person.
A son of one's sibling or of one's sibling-in-law.
A daughter of one's brother or sister, or the daughter of one's brother-in-law or sister-in-law.
a man to whom someone is engaged to be married
a woman who is engaged to be married
a male partner in a romantic or dating relationship
a female with whom someone is in a romantic or dating relationship; a woman who is a person's romantic partner
an adult human male
An adult human female.
a male child or young male person; a son or young male under the age of adulthood (often used to contrast with 'girl')
a female child or young woman (commonly used for a person who is not yet an adult)
a person whom one knows, likes, and trusts; someone who provides companionship, support, or help
a human being; an individual of the species Homo sapiens
an unspecified or unknown person; a person who is not identified or named (e.g., "Someone left their umbrella here.")
anyone: any person; any individual, regardless of identity
all people; every person
a person who does not exist or is not specified; no person
a person; a member of the species Homo sapiens
a person who is hostile or opposed to someone
a polite or formal term of address for a man
a polite or formal term for a woman
people in general
a supernatural being or deity
a married woman
an imaginary being of great size
a man or boy
a person who accompanies another
a married man in relation to his spouse.
a very young child or infant.
a person whom one does not know; a foreigner or outsider.
a person employed to perform domestic duties in a household.
a person confined in prison or held in captivity.
